wikipedia_page.main: Brigadier-General Charles Granville Fortescue,  (20 October 1861 – 1 February 1951) was an officer of the British Army in the colonial wars of the late 19th century, the Second Boer War and the First World War.

response: *Brigadier-General Hon. Charles Granville Fortescue (born 30 October 1861, died 1 February 1951), married Ethel Clarke, daughter of Sir Charles Clarke, 3rd Baronet and had issue.
*Lieutenant-Colonel and Brevet-Colonel the Honourable Charles Granville Fortescue, C.M.G., D.S.O., Commanding 1st Battalion, The Rifle Brigade (The Prince Consort's Own).
* Charles Granville Fortescue (1861–1951), British Army officer
* Major the Honourable Charles Granville Fortescue, for services in the Northern Territories of the Gold Coast.
* Charles Granville Fortescue (1861–1951), British Army officer
